abstract: The company plans to follow the lead of Google, which responded to a European court’s online privacy ruling in May by creating a form to request removal of links to material that individuals say violates their online privacy.
snippet: The company plans to follow the lead of Google, which responded to a European court’s online privacy ruling in May by creating a form to request removal of links to material that individuals say violates their online privacy.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Microsoft has kept its head down since a European court in May ruled that people could ask Internet search services to delink personal information.

headline.main: Microsoft Taking Steps to Comply With the Right to be Forgotten
